title: Thunderbird does not recognize that a message has been answered using Outlook Web App
content:
I am using both Outlook Web App (OWA, weaning myself off it) and Thunderbird. If I reply to a message using Thunderbird, both Thunderbird and OWA recognize that the message has been answered and they both add an arrow icon to the message. However, if I reply to a message using OWA, Thunderbird does not recognize that the message has been answered. Is that normal? Shouldn't it see the \Answered flag on the IMAP server?

I'm using IMAP on an Exchange server, and this happens with Thunderbird Beta 138.0b4 and Daily 139.0a1 (2025-04-23) under Windows.

Thank you.
creator: robert.funnell

title: Not receiving new emails
content: Last emails I have received through Thunderbird on my computer was April 17, 2025. the email provider is shaw.ca. I still receive emails since then on my phone or on my computer when I login to the shaw webmail site. How can I fix this?

content:

Appreciate any help to understand this.

title: Open links with a specific browser
content:
This drives me nuts. I want Thunderbird to open links in a specified browser (not the default). I checked the https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/hyperlinks-in-messages-not-working#w_check-that-no-application-is-specified-for-the-http-content-type page and found no solution. In my settings > general > Files & Attachments I don't have any http/https entries. In the config I set the "network.protocol-handler.external-default" to false, "network. protocol-handler.warn-external.http" and "network. protocol-handler.warn-external.https" to true. When I click a link, nothing happens.

I'm on Fedora 42 (Gnome), tried both Fedora binary and flatpak. No luck so far.

I would appreciate your help.
creator: tarpanEN

title: Thunderbird email
content: Ik gebruik Thunderbird Email (Linux Mint) en bij het opstarten worden er lege mappen gekopieerd met zowel een mbox-extensie als zonder deze extensie. Kan iemand mij helpen?

title: Lähetys ei onnistu
content:
Hei Käytän windowsin smtp.office365.com lähtevän palvelinta. Sähköpostien lähetys ei onnistu Thunderbirdissä. Thunderbird kyllä vastaanottaa viestit. Virheilmoitus väittää, että yhteyttä ei pystytä luomaan tai palvelin on varattu tai palvelin estää pyynnön. Tämä ongelma on ollut noin vuoden ajan ja on ilmestyyt itsestään. Välillä on vähän aikaa toiminut ja taas lakannut toimimasta. Selaimen kautta tuo windowsin palvelin kyllä toimii molempiin suuntiin. Käyttöjärjestelmät ovat läppärissä Win10 ja pöytäkoneessa Win11

Terveisin: Jouni Hautala jouni.hautala@jhautala.fi
creator: jouni.hautala

creator: theking2

title: Email Account Integration
content:
Approximately ten years ago, my internet service provider included a webmail account, “LIME Email Zimbra suite of communication tools” (the name of my internet service provider at that time was “LIME”) with the internet service they provided. I used this with “Thunderbird” until recently basically without any problems. However, during 2024 I started to get many scam email problems. Late in 2024, the bank with which I have my bank accounts here, recommend that I cease using the Zimbra suite and transfer all my dealing with them to a Gmail account as they feared that I would probably be hacked. I have done that but problems remain with it.

A few weeks ago this got worse and I got over 200 emails for LIME's (now named FLOW) Billpay system advising of overdue accounts, none of which were mine. I have reported this to FLOW but that have given me no assistance. I understand that they intend phasing out use of the Zimbra suite.

Currently, both the Zimbra and Gmail accounts are integrated into Thunderbird on my system.

My question is, can I remove the Zimbra suite completely and incorporate this into my Gmail account?

Can you please assist on this?
creator: dforrest

title: How to resolve S/MIME certificate issues
content:
I'm trying to send encrypted email to a recipient who I have a certificate for, but Thunderbird states:

End-to-end encryption requires resolving certificate issues for ....

That's rather unhelpful - what issues exactly? I've imported the CA certs into the system and they are shown in TB. openssl verify on the cert returns OK. I'm at a loss as to what might be the issue.
creator: opoplawski1

title: Thunderbird storing Google verification codes?
content:
Hello

I've been setting up Thunderbird on MacOS. I was adding few Gmail accounts. Every account was using 2FA so I had to enter new verification code each time. When I was adding 3rd or 4th account and was entering Google verification code into the form it suggested one of the codes I used before. Codes had same first two numbers so I guess I know why this form suggested one of the old codes but where does Thunderbird store these codes? I've deleted search history and cache in Thunderbird and attempted adding another gmail account but this time when I was asked for 2FA code I started with older verification codes and this form remembered all of them. Is there a way to remove them? Where does Thunderbird store these codes?

Thanks for any suggestions
creator: Macmac

title: Too large message, but can't undo - or find where the message/attachment still exists
content: I (by mistake) tried go attach a file that was too big to send in a Thunderbird (gmail) message. Even though I click "Cancel" to the warning "Warning! You are about to send a message of size 29.6 MB. Are you sure you want to do this?" the warning reappears each time I open Thunderbird (and I have to close and restart it to have it send any e-mails). The offending message is not in the drafts or trash folders. How do I tell Tbird to stop trying to send this message?
